messages.content: This is a once in a generation election. December 12th offers us the choice between a lurch to the far right, spearheaded by a Johnson, Farage and Trump alliance, or a country which offers hope and opportunity for everyone.

I'm proud to be standing as Labour’s Parliamentary Candidate here in Broxtowe, a place where I've lived all my life. I was born in Attenborough, I went to school in Chilwell and I now live in Beeston with my wife Jane and our two daughters. Broxtowe is the place I love to call home. It's the place where I've served local residents for nine years as a member of Broxtowe Borough Council; and where I've spent the last five years serving as Vice Chair of governors at the school I went to when I was younger.

Right now, we need this Brexit deadlock breaking, and I want the Labour party to be the ones to do this as a government who will be fighting austerity, deliver 400,000 new green jobs as part of a Green New Deal, and invest in more doctors and more nurses. A Labour government who would reduce class sizes and provide free school meals for primary children. A Labour government who would end student tuition fees and protect winter fuel allowance, free TV licenses and free bus passes for pensioners.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Create a privatized NHS, chlorinated chicken, and remove ourselves from a position of influence in the world.
Raise the bar for workers, provide strong public services, lead the world in tackling the climate crisis, and start reversing the devastating effects of ten years of Tory austerity.
Fight austerity and invest in more doctors and more nurses.
Deliver 400,000 new green jobs as part of a Green New Deal.
Reduce class sizes and provide free school meals for primary children. End student tuition fees.
Protect winter fuel allowance, free TV licenses, and free bus passes for pensioners.

mentions.otherPartyLeaderCandidate: Johnson, Farage, Trump, Anna Soubry, Darren Henry

personalStories.story: Born in Attenborough, went to school in Chilwell, living in Beeston with wife and two daughters.

examples: Anna Soubry votes to permit fracking in Broxtowe.
We won't be fooled by his claims about his love of Broxtowe any more than we'll be fooled by his claims to be a pro-Brexit campaigner when he voted for remain.
Anna Soubry votes to permit fracking in Broxtowe.
Henry tried for the Police and Crime Commissioner in Wiltshire, then he tried to get selected as an MP for Kensington.
